caption: Observability Metric
description: Observability Metric events report metrics data from a running device or service that is either logged or proactively collected. For example, when collecting device information such as such as CPU usage, memory utilization, disk I/O, or network traffic.
name: observability_metric

app.description: Information about the application generating or associated with the observability metrics. This may include the application's name, version, or unique identifier, providing context about which software component the metrics pertain to.

device.description: The device or system generating observability metrics. This can include physical devices, virtual machines, or services being monitored for metrics.

src_endpoint.description: The source endpoint generating observability metrics. This can include networks and endpoint services being monitored for metrics.

web_resources.description: Information about the web-based resource associated with the observability metric. This may include the resource's URL, path, content type, or service endpoint. It provides context for metrics that relate to specific web assets, such as API endpoints, web pages, or static content, which can be useful for performance monitoring and troubleshooting.

metrics.description: The specific observability metrics being reported for the device or service. This could include metrics such as CPU usage, memory utilization, disk I/O, network traffic, or any other performance-related data collected for monitoring purposes.
